cause.description:
CHAP was formed in September of 2000 with the mission is to reduce the spread of HIV and ensure a compassionate response to both infected and affected persons in Central VA.
CHAP has coordinated and implemented programs on the international, national, state, and local levels. These programs include International AIDS Memorial and Mobilization, World AIDS Day, National HIV Testing Day, and The Black Church Week of Prayer for the Healing of AIDS. Upon request, CHAP has educated the community by providing HIV awareness in schools, civic organizations, youth centers, jails, businesses, colleges, and churches. If you are interested in having a speaker at your workplace or agency, please contact Gloria Berkley, President, at 434-455-5082.
1. Central VA needs to be aware that there are 1,378 in our area with HIV/AIDS
2. the public needs to know about the the public about the prevention, treatment, and impact of HIV/AIDS
3. Persons living with HIV/AIDS and their families need support and love
cause.mission: educate about HIV prevention, treatment, and impact, coordinate resources for persons living with HIV/AIDS, discover their unmet needs, stimulate and support community response to meet those needs
cause.name: CHAP - Central VA AIDS Awareness and Prevention
